messages.subject: Re: New member.
messages.msgSnippet: ... You can find all of the ones that are still in print at amazon.co.jp, however the Shingen books look like they are out of print. Uesugi Kenshin is still in
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "amilne70" <kenshin@...> wrote:
>
> Greetings. I have just discovered and joined the group. It looks great.
>
> I was hoping that someone might be able to tell me where I can locate
> any books on Samurai in the Japanese "Gakken" series. In particular, I
> am looking for books on Uesugi Kenshin and Shingen Takeda. I own just
> about everything done on them in english.
>
> Thanks for any help.
>
> Danny
>

You can find all of the ones that are still in print at amazon.co.jp,
however the Shingen books look like they are out of print. Uesugi
Kenshin is still in print, and you can get it here:
http://tinyurl.com/p5nn6

I have ordered quite a bit off amazon.co.jp, the shipping usually runs
about $10, and I get it within 7 days or so.

messages.subject: New member.

messages.messageBody:
Greetings. I have just discovered and joined the group. It looks great.

I was hoping that someone might be able to tell me where I can locate
any books on Samurai in the Japanese "Gakken" series. In particular, I
am looking for books on Uesugi Kenshin and Shingen Takeda. I own just
about everything done on them in english.

Thanks for any help.

Danny
